title: Clinical Supervisor - LCSW - Addiction Services
description:
**Compensation and Bonus Package**

75-80k Negotiable salary

35 hr work week with hybrid availability

Amazing benefits, CEUs

**Hybrid one day from home**

**About the Organization and Position**

Well known non-profit in Upper Manhattan is searching for an experienced **Clinical Supervisor** for their Addiction Services program that is in high growth mode.

This organization as a whole provides behavioral support services to the local community and is well known for their therapeutic preschool, child and adolescent programs and case management and therapeutic support for adults.

We are offering an excellent compensation package including best in class benefits for this position.

**What’s Special About this Job**

Amazing team providing cutting edge treatment, collaboration and support. Low turnover staff and employees feel supported, lots of growth opportunities!

**Responsibilities**

* Supervises and direct all activities in establishing a therapeutic environment
* Participates in the ongoing evaluation of clients and, where indicated, makes recommendations for changes in treatment schedule, changes or, facility transfers, expulsions, hospital (or other agency) referrals.
* Responsible for follow-up on all assignments to subordinate staff
* Performs one-to-one counselling with treatment participants, as necessary, on an ongoing basis, relating all data to the director.
* Assists the Program Director in overseeing the day-to-day operations of the facility, and fulfils the role of
* Supervisor in the absence of the Program Director
* Assists the Program Director with recruiting and interviewing new staff.
* Completes monthly reports for OASAS.

**Experience**

* LCSW with SUDS experience preferred.
* Knowledge of human behavior and psychosocial dynamics of substance abuse.
* Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing.
* Ability to identify and assess symptoms relating to substance abuse.
* Ability to perform under clinical and administrative pressures.
* Respects the individuality of each patient.
* Operation, planning and supervisory skills.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $75,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Hybrid remote in New York, NY 10001

title: Associate, Situational Analytics
description:
**About the Role:**  

**Grade Level (for internal use):** 08
  
  

**About the Role:**  

**The Team:**  

The Situational Analytics team is a dynamic, globally diverse group which works with IR teams and C-Suites undergoing significant transformations. The team works on a project basis and has partnerships with IR consultancies, banks, and exchanges to service our clients as well as theirs.
  
  

**Responsibilities and Impact:**  

As a Situational Analytics Associate, you will have the opportunity to help drive the growth of our Investor Relations consulting services and make an immediate impact on the business and our corporate clients. The team is seeking an analyst eager to get first-hand experience working with IR teams and C-Suites through transformational events. We’re looking for an associate to:
  
  

Support clients with analysis of risk and opportunity, from data derivation to final c-suite-ready presentations
  
  

Take on incoming requests from partner relationships independently
  
  

Research projects for different elements of broader analyses, such as sustainability or index inclusion
  
  

Participate in the growth and improvement of the team’s service offering to clients
  
  

Assist in producing marketing materials/case studies for internal teams and external clients/prospects
  
  

**Compensation/Benefits Information:**  

S&P Global states that the anticipated base salary range for this position is $53,898.00 to $96,049.50. Final base salary for this role will be based on the individual’s geographic location, as well as experience level, skill set, training, licenses and certifications. In addition to base compensation, this role is eligible for an annual incentive plan. This role is eligible to receive additional S&P Global benefits. For more information on the benefits we provide to our employees, please click here .
  
  

**Basic Required Qualifications:**  

Detail-oriented; able to multi-task; strong organizational and time management skill
  
  

Comfortable in client-facing situations and interested in presenting to clients at a high level
  
  

Ability to utilize Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint
  
  

Analytical reasoning ability as well as effective speaking and written communication skills
  
  

**Additional Preferred Qualifications:**  

Undergraduate degree in a financial or quantitative-related discipline, focus on data analytics a plus
  
  

Experience with S&P Cap IQ Pro
  
  

Collaborative skill set that allows you to work within a dynamic and inclusive team
  
  

Demonstrated interest and understanding of capital markets
  
  

**Right to Work Requirements:**  

This role is limited to persons with indefinite right to work in the United States.
  
  

**Return to Work:**  

Have you taken time out for caring responsibilities and are now looking to return to work? As part of our Return to Work initiative, Restart, we are encouraging enthusiastic and talented returners to apply, and will actively support your return to the workplace.
  
  

About S&P Global Market Intelligence
  
  

At S&P Global Market Intelligence, a division of S&P Global we understand the importance of accurate, deep and insightful information. Our team of experts delivers unrivaled insights and leading data and technology solutions, partnering with customers to expand their perspective, operate with confidence, and make decisions with conviction.
  
  

For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/marketintelligence .
  
  

What’s In It For You?
  
  

**Our Purpose:**  

Progress is not a self-starter. It requires a catalyst to be set in motion. Information, imagination, people, technology–the right combination can unlock possibility and change the world.
  
  

Our world is in transition and getting more complex by the day. We push past expected observations and seek out new levels of understanding so that we can help companies, governments and individuals make an impact on tomorrow. At S&P Global we transform data into Essential Intelligence®, pinpointing risks and opening possibilities. We Accelerate Progress.
  
  

**Our People:**  

We're more than 35,000 strong worldwide—so we're able to understand nuances while having a broad perspective. Our team is driven by curiosity and a shared belief that Essential Intelligence can help build a more prosperous future for us all.
  
  

From finding new ways to measure sustainability to analyzing energy transition across the supply chain to building workflow solutions that make it easy to tap into insight and apply it. We are changing the way people see things and empowering them to make an impact on the world we live in. We’re committed to a more equitable future and to helping our customers find new, sustainable ways of doing business. We’re constantly seeking new solutions that have progress in mind. Join us and help create the critical insights that truly make a difference.
  
  

**Our Values:**  

Integrity, Discovery, Partnership
  
  

At S&P Global, we focus on Powering Global Markets. Throughout our history, the world's leading organizations have relied on us for the Essential Intelligence they need to make confident decisions about the road ahead. We start with a foundation of integrity in all we do, bring a spirit of discovery to our work, and collaborate in close partnership with each other and our customers to achieve shared goals.
  
  

**Benefits:**  

We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.
  
  

**Our benefits include:**  

**Health & Wellness:** Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
  
  

**Flexible Downtime:** Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
  
  

**Continuous Learning:** Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
  
  

**Invest in Your Future:** Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
  
  

**Family Friendly Perks:** It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
  
  

**Beyond the Basics:** From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.
  
**For more information on benefits by country visit:** https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries
  
  

**Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at S&P Global:**  

At S&P Global, we believe diversity fuels creative insights, equity unlocks opportunity, and inclusion drives growth and innovation – Powering Global Markets. Our commitment centers on our global workforce, ensuring that our people are empowered to bring their whole selves to work. It doesn’t stop there, we strive to better reflect and serve the communities in which we live and work, and advocate for greater opportunity for all.
  
  

-----------------------------------------------------------
  
  

Equal Opportunity Employer
  
S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.
  
  

If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.
  
  

**US Candidates Only:** The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law.

title: RETAIL INVENTORY SPECIALIST
description:
MICRO CENTER is the nation’s leading computer and electronic device big box retailer! Our technology superstore has an industry-leading 40,000+ selection of premier computer products and the most knowledgeable staff in the business. Passion, Energy & Commitment describe life at Micro Center. We are passionate about customer service and developing long-term customer relationships. We are looking for those that are committed to these same values.



We are currently seeking self-motivated, results oriented **Retail Inventory Specialists**. It is Micro Center’s core promise to take care of our associates and customers which has led to our success over the last 40+ years!


**Salary Range is = $17-21 per hour**


**MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:**


* Execute the 18-minute Web Pick-Up processes and ensure customer satisfaction
* Process incoming and outgoing shipments (including pick-packs, backhauls, return-to-vendor merchandise, etc.)
* Maintain the department and store by ensuring clean work areas, conducting cycle counts, stocking and replenishing product and participating in merchandising activities
* Support store operations by maintaining loss prevention awareness; help to prepare for and conduct physical inventory
* Assemble floor displays and re-sets
* Assist customers and perform carry-in/out
* Participate in open and close procedures
* Perform other duties and tasks as assigned


**EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE:**

* High school diploma or equivalent
* Knowledge of Microsoft Office
* Sincere interest in helping customers and driving world-class customer experiences
* Ability to communicate professionally and handle multiple customers
* Professional appearance and demeanor
* Physical requirements: lift up to 50 lbs. repeatedly throughout duration of shift, stand for prolonged periods of time
* Shifts include hours before and after the store is open to the public and may also include mornings, nights, weekends and holidays
* Previous retail customer service or warehouse experience strongly preferred


**MICRO CENTER OFFERS EXCEPTIONAL BENEFITS:**


* Flexible Schedules & Excellent Pay
* Medical, Dental and Vision Benefits Coverage for Regular Full-Time Associates
* Employee Discount that includes a Friends & Family Discount Program
* Tuition Reimbursement & Education Discounts
* Paid Time Off for Regular Associates
* 401K Plan with Company Match
* Esteemed Vendor & Company Job Training
* Career Advancement Opportunities


**OUR GROWTH OPPORTUNITIES:**



At Micro Center, we empower our employees to set their sights high and blaze their own trails. This is a place where your future success and growth are truly a result of your own efforts and achievements. Our teams are made up of motivated individuals who work hard to advance their careers. Join our team and see how hard work, loyalty, competitive spirit and unwavering commitment to the customer can take you and your career to new places.


**Micro Center is an Equal Opportunity Employer.**

title: Patient Experience Coordinator & Receptionist Dental
description:
#### **Treatment Coordinator**



Are you passionate about making people smile? Join Diamond Braces as a **Treatment Coordinator!** Enjoy growth opportunities, great benefits, and a supportive team that's all about creating world-class smiles. Ready to make smiles your business? We’d love to meet you!


#### **Why Diamond Braces?**



At Diamond Braces, your career growth is our priority. We provide continuous opportunities to learn, advance, and take on new challenges. As part of our team, you’ll have a clear path to success, with the support and resources you need to reach your professional goals while making a meaningful impact on our clients’ lives.


#### **What We Offer:**


* Competitive salary + performance-based bonuses
* Health, Dental, and Vision insurance packages
* Paid Time Off (PTO)
* 401(k) with company match
* Discounted orthodontic care for you and your family
* Ample growth & advancement opportunities
* Convenient office locations

#### **Essential Functions:**


* Educate Clients on Healthy Smiles: Help clients understand why a healthy smile is important by clearly explaining the long-term benefits of dental care. Make the treatment process exciting and easy to grasp.
* Guide Through Treatment Choices: Support clients in making informed decisions by providing simple, clear explanations of their treatment options and the benefits they can expect.
* Answer Questions: Use strong communication skills to respond to client inquiries, whether in person, over the phone, or via email, ensuring they feel well-supported and informed.
* Manage Appointments Smoothly: Keep the schedule running efficiently by optimizing appointment times, reducing wait times, and maintaining a smooth client flow.
* Greet Clients Warmly: Welcome every client with a friendly attitude, creating a comfortable and positive environment from the moment they walk in.
* Provide Clear Information: Make sure clients have all the information and documents they need, showing transparency and commitment to their care.
* Verify Insurance Details: Confirm clients' insurance eligibility, usage, and limitations. Follow up with them on their benefits and coverage as needed.
* Support the Dental Team: Assist dentists and other team members as needed, ensuring the practice operates smoothly and efficiently.
* Maintain a Clean Workspace: Keep your work area clean and safe, helping to prevent the spread of infection and protect the well-being of clients and staff.
* Stay Flexible: Be ready to handle any additional tasks as needed, adapting to the changing needs of the practice.

#### **Preferred Qualifications:**


* Bilingual abilities are a plus.
* Experience in retail, sales, or a similar customer-focused role.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Proficiency in computer literacy.
* Managerial experience is an advantage.
* Clear long-term career goals aligned with our company values.

#### **Who We Are:**



At Diamond Braces, we believe in improving lives through healthier smiles. Our mission is to provide orthodontic care that is affordable, accessible, and delivered with amazing customer service—**the 'AAA Experience.'** We’re committed to making every smile count, and we live by our **“No Smile Left Behind”** philosophy.


#### **Additional Information:**


* This position is full-time, and local travel between offices may be required.
* Salary is based on experience, skills, and qualifications.
* Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.


If you’re ready to take the next step in your career and help our clients achieve the smile of their dreams, **apply today!**

title: Guest Sales Associate
description:
Applicants must have evening and weekend availability!

**European Wax Center Levittown is looking to add Guest Service Associate** to our growing team! We believe that happy employees make happy guests, so you can expect a fun, upbeat, flexible work environment! \\*\\*THIS IS A SALES POSITION!\\*\\*

**MUST BE AVAILABLE EVENINGS AND WEEKENDS!**

**Benefits**

* The full hourly pay for this position starts at $16/ hr and ends up being approx. $19-30/hr, the overall hourly pay will depend on incentives such as wax package sales.
* Flexible scheduling.
* Free waxing & 40% off all retail products.
* 401(k) matching
* Referral Program
* Paid time off

Turn your passion into a rewarding role with European Wax Center — the world’s leading experts in comfortable and healthy body waxing! We’re in the business of Revealing Beautiful Skin®, and with your help, we’ll give guests a reason to walk in, and strut out. European Wax Center Levittown, NY is currently seeking a sensational Guest Services Associate with passion, determination and a commitment to excellence that will help take our center to new heights. With a competitive compensation package and access to a franchise support system with developed procedures, training and systems designed to make the impossible, possible, what are you waiting for?

**Here’s What We’re Looking For:**

* Ability to work days, evenings and at least one weekend day.
* A positive, friendly, upbeat and personable demeanor
* Ability to work in a FUN, fast-paced environment
* Develop a thorough understanding of European Wax Center services and products
* Arrive to work timely following the appropriate dress code, including wearing of the required name tag
* Create a memorable guest experience by utilizing EWC terminology and tailoring the scripts and standard responses while working in the location
* Confirm each guest service(s) and offer recommended/related add on service(s)
* Administer check-ins and check-outs, processing payments, refunds and reservation requests
* Inform the guest of the prebooking benefits and how to utilize the app to reschedule
* Educate guests on benefits and savings of Wax Passes
* Organize the reservation book based on guest requests and associate availability
* Perform opening and closing procedures for the center
* Maintain a safe, sparkling clean, organized and visually pleasant environment within lobby and restrooms
* Other duties as assigned

This job description is a general description of essential job functions. It is not intended to describe all duties someone in this position may perform. All employees of EWC and operating subsidiaries are expected to perform tasks as assigned by supervisory/management personnel, regardless of job title or routine job duties.

European Wax Center is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $17.00 - $22.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Paid time off

Shift:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Evening shift

Work Location: In person

title: Behaviorist
description:
**Responsibilities:**

* Meets with consumers as assigned to develop and implement Behavior Support Plans (BSP).
* Regularly reviews and revises the plan
* Trains staff directly working with the consumer to implement the BSP
* Compiles internal and external reports as required
* Acts as a member of a team addressing significant behavioral and/or medical changes in consumers.

* Must be 21 years of age or older
* Bachelor's degree in psychology, sociology and/or a related field
* 2 years of experience working with persons with disabilities who have mental illness and behavioral issues.
* Experience in developing, implementing, and monitoring behavior plans
* Experience with behavioral and/or psychiatric assessments and interventions
* Ability to train and coach staff to implement Behavior Support Plans (BSP)/Guidelines
* Ability to effectively complete necessary work-related documentation through paper and electronic records systems

* Ability to write progress notes

title: Direct Support Professional
description:
Job Overview:  
We are seeking compassionate and dedicated individuals to join our team as Direct Support Professionals. As a Direct Support Professional, you will provide essential care and support to individuals with diverse needs, including seniors, individuals with disabilities, and those requiring hospice or dementia care. This rewarding role involves assisting with daily activities, promoting independence, and ensuring the well-being of our clients.

Responsibilities:  
- Provide direct care and support to individuals in their homes or residential facilities  
- Assist with personal hygiene tasks, including bathing, grooming, and dressing  
- Supporting individuals in participating in community activities, social events, recreational outings, and educational programs to promote community integration and inclusion.  
- Assist with meal planning, preparation, and feeding as needed  
- Engage clients in meaningful activities and social interactions  
- Monitor and document client's health status and report any changes to the appropriate healthcare professionals  
- Safely lift and transfer clients using proper body mechanics and assistive devices  
- Ensuring the safety and well-being of individuals by monitoring their environment, identifying potential hazards, and intervening in crisis situations when necessary  
- Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team to develop and implement individualized care plans

Requirements:  
- Valid driver's license and reliable transportation  
- High School Diploma  
- Ability to lift and move heavy objects or assist clients with mobility limitations  
- Familiarity with electronic documentation systems for recording client information  
- Excellent communication skills to effectively interact with clients, families, and healthcare professionals  
- Compassionate nature and a genuine desire to make a positive impact on the lives of others

If you are passionate about providing quality care and support to individuals in need, we encourage you to apply for this fulfilling position. Join our team of dedicated professionals today!

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $18.00 - $20.00 per hour

Schedule:

* Day shift
* No nights
* No weekends

Ability to Relocate:

* Hopewell, NJ: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: HR Coordinator
description:
**Regulatory Compliance & Policy Development:**

Harris Energy Solutions, LLC (HES) is seeking a dedicated and experienced Full-Time Human Resources Manager to join our team at the Piscataway, NJ office. This role will ensure that the company remains compliant with evolving HR laws and regulations across multiple states and oversees critical HR functions such as recruitment, onboarding, employee relations, and performance management. The ideal candidate will possess a strong knowledge of HR best practices and have excellent interpersonal and organizational skills.

**Essential Duties & Responsibilities:**

* Ensure compliance with ever-changing regulations and employment laws in the various states where HES has employees.
* Develop, update, and maintain HR policies that align with local, state, and federal laws.
* Stay abreast of HR legal changes and adjust company policies accordingly.

**Interview Process:**

* Review resumes for non-engineering positions and assess candidate qualifications.
* Conduct initial interviews, provide feedback, and make recommendations for the next stage of the hiring process.
* Conduct reference checks on prospective employees to verify qualifications and work history.
* Present verbal job offers to selected candidates and guide them through the acceptance process.

**Onboarding & Training:**

* Lead the onboarding process for new hires, including I9 verification and reviewing the employee handbook.
* Provide email etiquette training for new employees to ensure effective communication practices.
* Conduct manager and interview training sessions to enhance internal team leadership capabilities.

**Employee Check-Ins & Relations:**

* Conduct regular check-ins with new employees at 1 week, 1 month, 3 months, and 6 months to monitor their integration into the company.
* Perform bi-annual check-ins with current employees to address concerns and provide ongoing support.

**Employee Relations & Performance Management:**

* Offer guidance on performance management and employment relations, assisting with problem-solving and dispute resolution.
* Handle complaints, disciplinary procedures, and sensitive employee matters with professionalism and discretion.
* Maintain and update employee records and files, ensuring data accuracy and compliance.
* Coordinate performance review processes in November, including preparation and conducting the reviews.

**Ending Employment & Exit Procedures:**

* Conduct exit interviews for departing employees and interns, ensuring a smooth transition out of the company.
* Oversee termination processes by managing the final write-up, sending final communication, and ensuring compliance with state and federal laws.
* Provide guidance during the termination process, ensuring fairness, legal compliance, and respectful treatment.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field.
* Minimum of 5 years of experience in Human Resources, including experience in compliance and policy development.
* Strong understanding of employment laws and regulations across multiple states.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to handle sensitive matters discreetly.
* Strong organizational skills with attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
* Proficiency in HR systems and tools, including employee record management and performance review processes.

**Preferred:**

* HR certification such as SHRM-CP, SHRM-SCP, or PHR.
* Experience in a multi-state environment, managing compliance across different jurisdictions.

**Personal Qualifications:**

* Strong analytical, writing, and presentation skills
* Passionate for mitigating climate change
* Collaborative and a strong team player
* Self-motived with the ability to multitask and pay attention to detail
* Ability to work independently and without a team environment
* Enthusiasm to learn and grow as a professional

**Why Join HES?** At Harris Energy Solutions, LLC, we value a culture of respect, collaboration, and continuous improvement. As the part-time HR Manager, you will play a pivotal role in supporting the growth and well-being of our employees while ensuring compliance with ever-evolving HR laws. We offer flexibility and a dynamic work environment where your contributions will make a significant impact.

**Benefits:**

Joining Harris Energy Solutions LLC offers the opportunity to work on exciting and challenging projects while making a positive impact on the environment and the community. We provide a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits package, and a supportive work environment where employees can thrive and grow in their careers. If you meet the qualifications outlined above and are passionate about sustainable design and innovation, we encourage you to apply for this position. Included benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) Safe Harbor
* Health Insurance
* Dental Insurance
* Vision Insurance
* FSA
* HSA
* Paid Time Off
* Paid Holidays
* Profit Share
* Disability Insurance
* Life Insurance
* Financial Advising

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $60,000.00 - $70,000.00 per year

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Piscataway, NJ (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: 7th and 8th Grade English Teacher - Experience Required
description:
**Job Summary**  
We are seeking an experienced and committed 7th and 8th Grade English Teacher to join our team at a public charter school in Newark, NJ, delivering positive student results in a caring school community for over 50 years. The 7th and 8th Grade English Teacher will have at least 3 years of teaching experience and be dedicated to providing a nurturing and educational environment for middle school students, with an understanding of the needs of our community and a commitment to equity.

**General Responsibilities**  
- Develop and implement engaging lesson plans that align with the school's curriculum  
- Provide a supportive and inclusive classroom environment that fosters learning and growth  
- Utilize learning technology to enhance teaching methods and student engagement  
- Monitor and assess student progress, providing feedback to students and parents, with an eye on data-informed instruction  
- Collaborate with colleagues on curriculum development and educational initiatives  
- Implement early intervention strategies for students who may require additional support  
- Mentor and guide students in their social, emotional, and academic development

- Partner with parents and families to support students' growth.

**Requirements**  
- Bachelor's degree, Education major preferred  
- NJ State teaching certification required, alternate route candidates welcome  
- Proven experience working with young children in an educational setting  
- Strong communication skills to effectively interact with students, parents, and colleagues  
- Knowledge of education administration and childcare best practices  
- Ability to educate and inspire young learners through creative teaching methods  
- Familiarity with curriculum for 5th grade students

title: Medical Front Desk Receptionist
description:
HerMD is seeking a Front Desk Receptionist to join our team in Millburn, NJ!

Our front office HerMD Team members are the first faces our patients see when they enter our building! Therefore, the successful candidate will possess a positive attitude, a smiling face, and exceptional organizational and customer service skill set.

This position is a full time position (5 days per week). - M, W, Th, F 8:00AM - 4:30PM, T 11:00AM - 7:00PM (late night).

Other responsibilities will include but are not limited to the following:

* Opening and closing office
* Greeting and assisting patients and visitors
* Answering phones and returning messages
* Routing messages to appropriate channel
* Fielding sales reps/vendor calls and visits to the office
* Navigating EMR/PM system
* Checking in GYN and Spa patients and providing them with appropriate paperwork
* Ensuring patient paperwork is completed thoroughly and input into EMR/PM system accurately
* Familiarity with scanning, printing, faxing, and other traditional office tasks
* Collecting copays/patient balances
* Checking patients out and collecting payments for cash-based services
* Allocating patient payments in EMR/PM system
* Schedule auditing and management
* Providing patients with samples/brochures requested by provider
* Scheduling and rescheduling patients
* Fielding patient Billing questions and referring them to the proper channels
* Maintaining knowledge of Spa services and Retail products
* Helping patients redeem e-commerce gift cards
* Log/redeem patient reward points through 3rd party websites
* Accepting mail/packages for office
* Maintaining/tidying office supplies
* Cleaning/sanitizing reception and patient lounge area
* Assist in supplies ordering/inventory
* Assist team with shared office-tasks (i.e. breakroom maintenance, bathroom supplies/stocking, garbage collection, etc)
* Notifying providers/MA staff with schedule changes
* Monitoring and updating multiple software program/apps used at the front desk

Requirements

* 1 year of medical office front desk experience required
* ObGYN or UroGYN experience is preferred
* 1 year of office experience required
* Data entry experience is preferred
* 1 year of customer service experience is preferred
* Strong organizational skills are required
* Willingness to participate in Marketing-related events for office location
* Work Location: Millburn, NJ 07041

Benefits

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

About HerMD

The care that patients deserve is here. At , we are revolutionizing women’s healthcare.

From gynecology and menopause to sexual health and medical aesthetics, our centers provide a safe, trusted space for our patients to address all their health concerns shame and stigma-free.

We offer in-person and virtual care with an expert team of board-certified OBGYNs, healthcare providers, aestheticians, and a vast network of referral partners.

By joining HerMD, you are joining a passionate team on a mission to educate, advocate for, and empower our patients. We hope you join us on our mission!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $21.00 - $23.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Disability insurance
* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Medical Specialty:

* Dermatology
* Ob/Gyn
* Urology

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Medical receptionist: 1 year (Required)
* Medical office: 1 year (Required)
* Ob/Gyn: 1 year (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Millburn, NJ 07041 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Millburn, NJ 07041: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Dental Office Manager
description:
Are you a skilled and driven leader with a passion for patient care and operational excellence? We are seeking an experienced Office Manager to join our dynamic, fast-growing practice! The ideal candidate will oversee the daily operations of our office, ensuring efficiency and effectiveness in all administrative tasks.

**Why Us?**

- State-of-the-art dental facility with a focus on patient-centered care

- Supportive and collaborative work environment

- Competitive salary, bonuses, and benefits package

- Opportunities for professional growth and leadership development

**What You'll Do:**

- Oversee the day-to-day operations of the practice, ensuring smooth workflow and optimal patient experience

- Develop and implement office policies and procedures to improve productivity

- Lead, mentor, and inspire a dedicated team of dental professionals

- Manage scheduling, billing, and inventory to maximize efficiency

- Handle patient concerns with care and professionalism

- Collaborate with clinical staff to ensure high-quality care delivery  
**What We're Looking For:**

- 3+ years of experience as a Dental Office Manager or in a similar leadership role

- Strong organizational, communication, and problem-solving skills

- Expertise in dental billing, insurance claims, and practice management software

- Ability to multitask and thrive in a fast-paced environment

- A passion for delivering exceptional patient service

We are seeking a skilled Project Manager to join our team with the ability to study master plans, SOWs and RFPs of capital projects and identify, quantify, document, and time-box all IT resources needed for each project. Time boxing is across all phases, Planning, Design, Build and Support.

Ability to request and acquire resources needed and ensure that all IT requirements, deliverables (in house and vendor) are defined, such as project plans, product designs, functionality, drawings, diagrams, installation guides, source code, etc. Ensure that all IT requirements and deliverables are instantiated in the Master Plan, SOW and RFP where appropriate. Ensure that all IT requirements and deliverables are current and up to date with IT Standards, Policies and Procedures. Ensure that IT resources are acquired, deployed, charge appropriately and quality IT work is delivered throughout the entire project process from “cradle to grave”.

title: Message Passing Software Developer
description:
Message Passing Software Developer  


This role has been designated as ‘Remote/Teleworker’, which means you will primarily work from home.**Who We Are:**


Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today’s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open up opportunities with HPE.

**Job Description:**

  

The HPE Cray Message Passing Toolkit team is seeking a Software Development Engineer to lead the development efforts on scalable communication libraries (MPI and OpenSHMEM) supporting our HPE Supercomputing interconnect fabric. This position will provide an opportunity to set the direction of the scalable communication libraries in the HPE Cray programming environment software stack.

  

This position can be remote.

 **About the Job:**

* Design, develop, debug, and tune parallel programming models like MPI and OpenSHMEM
* Evaluate multiple parallel programming solutions in exploiting various hardware technologies like next-generation HPC interconnects, CPUs, and GPUs
* Participate in MPI and OpenSHMEM standards committees to lead discussions on introducing new features in high-level parallel programming models
* Propose improvements for next-generation software and hardware
* Ability to work independently
* Interact and support customer engagements

**About You:**

* Familiarity in multiple high level parallel programming models, such as, MPI, OpenSHMEM, UPC, Global Arrays, and/or Coarray Fortran in a Linux environment
* Knowledge on general HPC components like compute, network, memory, and storage
* An understanding of high-performance computing
* BS in Computer Science or equivalent
* Willingness to work on multiple projects
* Good communication skills

**Preferred:**

* Experience with parallel programming styles specifically PGAS and RMA
* Experience in using network library interfaces like libfabric, UCX, and/or Verbs
* Ability to do performance analysis at scale
* MS, or PhD in Computer Science or equivalent

**Additional Skills:**


Cloud Architectures, Cross Domain Knowledge, Design Thinking, Development Fundamentals, DevOps, Distributed Computing, Microservices Fluency, Full Stack Development, Security-First Mindset, Solutions Design, Testing & Automation, User Experience (UX)**What We Can Offer You:**

**Health & Wellbeing**


We strive to provide our team members and their loved ones with a comprehensive suite of benefits that supports their physical, financial and emotional wellbeing.

**Personal & Professional Development**


We also invest in your career because the better you are, the better we all are. We have specific programs catered to helping you reach any career goals you have — whether you want to become a knowledge expert in your field or apply your skills to another division.

**Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging**


We are unconditionally inclusive in the way we work and celebrate individual uniqueness. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good.

**Let's Stay Connected:**


Follow @HPECareers on Instagram to see the latest on people, culture and tech at HPE.

title: Director, Restaurant Operations Services
description:
**Do you thrive on making complex systems work better and more efficiently? Are you a strategic & analytical thinker with a passion for transforming restaurant operations into seamless, high-performing environments? If you love the restaurant and hospitality industry and have the expertise to drive innovation and excellence, Boqueria Restaurants has an exciting opportunity for you!**


***Hospitality Experience is Required for this Role***


***Working a hybrid work schedule with certain days in our Manhatten office is Required for this Role***


**Boqueria® Restaurants** is on a mission to be a best-in-class operator in the restaurant industry – and are looking for a dedicated Director of Operations Services to lead the charge. Boqueria is a Spanish tapas restaurant group on the East Coast, with 10 locations spread throughout NYC, DC, Chicago, Boston, and West Hartford and an 11th set to open in Atlanta.



**Are you our Director of Restaurant Operations Services?**



As the **Director of Operations Services**, you'll be a driving force behind the operational excellence and innovation that define Boqueria. This pivotal role will empower you to lead transformative initiatives, refine processes, and develop talent—ensuring that Boqueria continues to be a top destination for tapas lovers while achieving both profitability and guest satisfaction.



**You’ll thrive in this position if you are:**





* A visionary strategist who elevates guest experiences while driving operational success.
* A culinary innovator with a passion for crafting menus that align with evolving market trends.
* A systems thinker with a history of optimizing processes to boost efficiency and profits.


**Responsibilities:**



**Here’s the kind of work you’ll get to do:**


* **Lead me****nu management** by ensuring platforms like Toast and third-party services are always up-to-date, enhancing both operational efficiency and guest experience.
* **Drive the product development cycle**, from concept to execution, ensuring every dish aligns with Boqueria’s brand and excites our guests.
* **Optimize inventory management** systems like Radar and provide field leadership training, ensuring precise Cost of Goods Sold (COGS) tracking and overall efficiency.
* **Implement seamless new offerings** by coordinating tastings, gathering actionable feedback, and integrating updates across all locations.
* **Leverage data insights** to refine menus and processes, consistently driving profitability and customer satisfaction.
* **Champion team development**, overseeing learning programs and providing feedback to elevate performance across all locations.
* **Support new restaurant openings**, leading operations logistics, training, and ensuring smooth integrations with POS systems.


**Qualifications:**



**Required**



* 5+ years of experience in food and beverage operations within a multi-unit restaurant or hospitality environment.
* Proven ability to enhance profitability and operational efficiency.
* Expertise in managing systems and processes related to inventory, COGS, and menu optimization.
* Strong leadership skills with a passion for mentoring and developing high-performing teams.
* Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities in a fast-paced environment.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.


**Preferred:**


* Advanced qualifications in business management, hospitality, or culinary arts.
* Expertise in food and beverage product development and operational management systems.
* Working knowledge of Toast POS, GoParrot, Radar Inventory Management, Menu Management software, and Data Analysis tools


**Why Boqueria?**



* Work with great people who love hospitality
* Competitive pay and comprehensive benefits
* A strong company culture with high standards
* Be part of growing an upscale restaurant group
We are an equal opportunity employer. We do not base our employment decisions on an applicant's race, sex, sexual orientation, age, color, national origin, citizenship, disability, handicap, veteran status, or any other factor prohibited by local, state, or federal law.

title: Customer Service/Call Center Appointment Coordinator
description:
**Job Description**
-------------------

* **Do you enjoy working on the phones and setting appointments?**
* **Are you looking for a place where leads are provided for you?**
* **Have you been successful in Telemarketing, Collections or Customer Service?**
* **Are you looking for a company who values you as a professional?**
* **Are you Bilingual?**

***Now is the time to elevate your career! Our business is busy and we need help immediately.***


No experience necessary - We will train you! We are hiring Customer Service/ BDC Representatives immediately. This is an entry-level car business position with a guaranteed base salary and easy to achieve bonuses.

**The Basics –**

* Make 100+ Outbound Phone Calls every day
* Learn and follow our scripted process for making and receiving phone calls
* Respond to customer emails immediately during scheduled hours
* Work as part of our team
* Learn the basics of the product line
* Record all work inside our CRM
* This position does work as late as 9 PM during the week and on Saturdays


This position answers incoming phone calls and emails from our customers. You will be setting appointments to test drive vehicles with our Sales personnel at the dealership. We are well known for our rapid growth and focus on our employees. This is a place you can call home. We are founded on the principle of giving great service to our customers, improving the lives of our Customers and Employees through great leadership, a culture of service and a love of learning.

**Essential Duties –**

* Communicate effectively with our customers via Phone, Internet or Text.
* Check email frequently and respond to customer inquiries immediately.
* Learn and follow the scripting required by our process.
* Set appointments for our customers to meet our employees and test drive vehicles.
* Study, learn and maintain knowledge of the vehicles we sell (We will train you!).
* Learn and maintain a thorough knowledge of Dealership policies, products and procedures.
* Establish personal goals that are consistent with the productivity requirements of the Dealership.
* Maintain a professional appearance.

**Qualifications -**

* *Language Skills Ability:* Read, write and understand short correspondence with our Management and employees. Read and interpret safety rules, guidelines and general business operating instructions as outlined by the Dealership. Read, type and understand proper grammar in written/typed communication.
* *Mathematical Skills Ability:* Add, Subtract, Multiply and Divide so that you can understand, interpret and communicate Vehicle Pricing and Manufacturer Incentive Programs. Calculate discounts, difference figures and required pricing as outlined by the manufacturers.
* *Reasoning Ability:* Apply a common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished verbally, in writing or via electronic communication. Solve practical problems and come up with solutions to the simple challenges that occur in life.You must have and maintain a great attitude to be successful in this position.

***Do people tell you that you are optimistic, always thinking about the positives and finding the good in all things? Your attitude is one of the keys to your success in the Automotive Industry.*** *If you complain a lot, please do not apply.*

**Compensation -** This position has a guaranteed salary while you train and spiffs and bonuses based upon work completed. Most of our BDC Representatives earn between $45,000 to $80,000 per year. We pay you while you learn and focus on helping you maximize your earning potential.

#### 

**Benefits**
------------

* Health Insurance
* Dental Insurance
* Vision Insurance
* Sick Leave
* 401(k)
* Paid Time Off (PTO)
* Competitive Pay Plans
* Employee Discount purchase program
* Employee Assistance programs
* Employee Referral Program

**Company Description**
-----------------------

**WHY WORK FOR THE ATLANTIC AUTO GROUP?**  

  

**The Atlantic Automotive Group provides the best opportunity for any Long Islander who wants to launch a career in the auto industry.** Atlantic has locations all over Long Island. Atlantic brands include Genesis, Hyundai, Honda, Toyota, Kia, Chevrolet & Cadillac.  

  

With over 1200 employees, **Atlantic is clearly one of the major employers in Nassau and Suffolk Counties.** As Atlantic continues to add new locations, finding new employees is a major priority.  

  

**The group firmly believes in cultivating talent from within,** seeking out talented employees who can become Atlantic’s future managers. Factory training is offered to qualified employees seeking certification in sales, service, or parts. Each Atlantic location is like a small city that requires dedicated workers of varying skills and experience levels.  

  

Atlantic is renowned for offering new opportunities to people with some automotive experience, ambitious workers with skills from other businesses, veterans who have served their country, both men and women, and/or to people of all backgrounds, ages, races, and nationalities.  

  

**WE WELCOME VETERANS**  

  

We believe in the abilities of our military, and we’re actively recruiting them to the Atlantic Auto Group team. Hiring a veteran can be one of the best decisions a company can make. Military veterans are quick learners and they're team players. They are leaders with discipline, training, and a passion for service. We’re actively recruiting veterans, transitioning military, service members, and their families to bring these attributes to Atlantic and to help us build a better business.  

  

**OUR BENEFITS**


We currently offer discounted vehicle purchases to all employees and medical, dental, and vision, paid time off & sick leave as well as 401k benefits to our full-time employees who’ve met their eligibility requirements. With competitive pay plans, a 401k program, and Atlantic’s commitment to customer service, it’s no surprise that the Atlantic Auto Group is the eighth largest privately-owned car dealership group in the country.

 **We want to hire only the best, so all applicants must successfully pass a drug and background check and have a clean and valid NY State License.**

**Schedule 5 Day (40 Hour) Workweek. Incl Weekends**
----------------------------------------------------


Schedule 5 Day (40 Hour) Workweek. must be able to work 4 weekdays and 1 weekend.

title: Traveling Construction Supervisor - Commercial Reconstruction
description:
**Lead Our Construction Projects: Join JWC Disaster Solutions as a Traveling Construction Supervisor - Commercial Reconstruction!** **"Providing and helping people with disaster solutions across the southeast and gulf markets with travel opportunities"** **Job Title: Traveling Construction Supervisor - Commercial Reconstruction****Company Name: JWC Disaster Solutions, LLC****Salary:** **$30.00/ hr** **Full Job Description**
JWC Disaster Solutions is seeking a qualified Traveling Construction Supervisor - Commercial Reconstruction to oversee our construction projects. This position involves complete project responsibility, including scheduling, coordination, and management of field commitments. The ideal candidate will have extensive knowledge of drywall and metal framing, strong organizational skills, and the ability to lead a team to ensure project success. **Who we are:**
JWC Disaster Solutions, LLC is a licensed and insured General Contractor specializing in drywall, framing, painting, and specialty coatings. Serving the General Contractor community as a subcontractor in the commercial markets, we are committed to helping businesses in times of crisis. When disaster strikes, we swiftly clean up the mess and rebuild the damage, ensuring minimal downtime for our clients. Our professional and skilled team is dedicated to providing high-quality solutions that restore and enhance commercial spaces. With a focus on safety, innovation, and excellence, JWC Disaster Solutions is a trusted partner in disaster recovery and construction.  

  

  

**Responsibilities include but are not limited to:*** Take full responsibility for project labor and material scheduling, coordination, and field commitments to see the project to success.
* Manage field personnel, prepare work schedules, and assign specific duties.
* Interpret and blueprints, designs, and contract terms to manage onsite installation.
* Provide daily quality control to ensure high standards are met.
* Maintain positive relationships with customers, contractors, suppliers, and employees.
* Mitigate delays and damages due to bad weather or emergencies on site.
* Ensure all project sites are clean and organized.
* Order materials and schedule necessary inspections.
* Keep cost records on work performed, including change orders and materials.
* Communicate daily with the project manager.

 **The ideal candidate should possess:*** Extensive knowledge of Commercial Interiors, including; steel studs, metal framing, drywall, acoustical ceilings, floorings, baseboard, doors, paint, etc.
* Working knowledge of the construction industry, including reading plans, layouts, and prints.
* Ability to schedule projects logically and budget the time required to meet deadlines.
* Ability to multitask effectively to complete daily tasks in time-sensitive projects.
* Experience in coordinating all site construction activities and supervising field personnel to complete jobs on schedule and within budget.
* Skilled in determining field requirements and assist with training new employees.
* Proficiency with cloud-based technologies such as schedule grids and email.
* Ability to inspect and review projects to monitor compliance with building and safety codes and to ensure quality standards are met.
* Capable of providing layout for new drywall partitions.
* Fluent in English; the ability to communicate in Spanish is strongly preferred.
* Must have a valid driver's license, a clean driving record, and reliable transportation.
* Willingness and flexibility to travel 100% of the time.

 **Benefits:*** **Medical/Dental/Vision Insurance Options:** Comprehensive health coverage to ensure your well-being.
* **Retirement Plan Options:** Secure your future with our retirement savings plans.
* **Paid Time Off:** Enjoy generous paid time off to recharge and spend time with family when not traveling.
* **Career Growth Opportunities:** Access pathways for professional advancement within the company.
* **Travel Opportunities:** Travel extensively to locations across the Southeast, with paid travel expenses and per diem.
* **Performance/Annual Bonuses:** Receive bonuses based on your performance and company achievements.
* **Continued Training/Certifications:** Pursue continued education and certification opportunities to enhance your skills.
* **Competitive Pay:** Enjoy competitive pay along with performance-based incentives.
* **Flexible Work Hours:** Benefit from flexible work hours to manage your schedule effectively.

 **Schedule:*** Full Time
* Monday to Friday
* Over Time Potential (including Weekends)


**Work Location:*** **Local job with travel between New Jersey and New York.**
* **Travel:** Extensive travel between New Jersey and New York as required.

 ***Join JWC Disaster Solutions and lead our construction projects to success! Apply now to become a key part of our team.*** *We foster a family-like environment where every employee is valued. As an equal opportunity employer, we prioritize diversity in our workforce, recognizing that innovation thrives on varied perspectives. We embrace individuals from diverse backgrounds, including ethnicity, religion, and education, without regard to race, age, gender, or sexual identity.*

title: Hybrid Social Worker (LMSW) - Bilingual English/Spanish
description:
**Position Summary:**
As a member of our Social Services Department, the **Social Worker (LMSW),** provides patients with supportive counseling, crisis intervention, psychoeducation, advocacy, and connections to support services. We are seeking Bilingual (English/Spanish) professional for a full-time opportunity stationed at our **Plaza Del Sol Family Health center in Corona, Queens.**

New grad LMSW are welcome! Clinical hours are provided! The current position is hybrid (3 days onsite and 2 days remote).
**Minimum Qualifications:*** Master's degree in social work, required.
* NYS LMSW Certification, required.
* Bilingual Spanish/English is required.
* Excellent communication skills.
* Dedication to supporting patients in our communities.
* Core computer skills including ability to maintain electronic health record.


**Key Duties:*** Conducts psychosocial assessments, provides supportive counseling, complex case management and crisis intervention.
* Works closely with the interdisciplinary team to assess and address patients' psychosocial barriers to care.
* Refers and connects patients with services including behavioral health treatment, and community-based organizations.
* Documents all in-person, and telephone encounters with patients in a timely manner
* Maintains patient confidentiality and HIPPA regulations per UHP policy.


**Starting Compensation:**
Minimum $67,600 per year; Maximum $75,000 per year
**Work Environment Type, Location, and Schedule:**
Hybrid, 4 days onsite, 1 day remote, Corona, Queens, Monday to Friday 8:00am-5:00pm.
**As a full time associate at Urban Health Plan, you'll enjoy:*** Fully funded Health Insurance for you/ 73.5% funded Health Insurance for your family
* Dental, Vision, and Prescription Coverage
* 401(k) Retirement Savings (including 3% annual employer contribution)
* Comprehensive time off including paid vacation, personal time, sick time, and paid holidays (including your birthday!)
* Flex Spending Accounts (Health care, Dependent Care, and Commuter Benefits)
* Entertainment Discount Programs
* Employee Assistant Program
* Eligibility to apply for Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program (PSLF)
* Fitness Discounts and Perks through our medical plan.
* $50,000 term life Insurance


**About Urban Health Plan:**
At Urban Health Plan (UHP) our mission is to continuously improve the health of communities and the quality of life of the people we serve by providing affordable, comprehensive, quality, primary and specialty health care and by assuring the performance and advancement of innovative best practices. At UHP, our commitment to provide patient-centered, holistic, quality health care, is part of a tradition started by our founder, Dr. Richard Izquierdo, more than 40 years ago. That tradition continues today by promoting excellence in everything that we do.*UHP is an equal opportunity employer. M/F/D/V. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin/ancestry, citizenship status, disability, age, marital or family status, and military or veteran status.*
